column2: The future has been filled with fear, stained and polluted by the heartless past.
column3: The future has been filled with fear, stained and polluted by the heartless past.

column2: Why should we fear that which will come to all that is?
column3: Why should we fear that which will come to all that is?

column2: We do not know which is the greatest blessing, life or death.
column3: We do not know which is the greatest blessing, life or death.

column2: Every cradle asks us "Whence?" and every coffin "Whither?"
column3: Every cradle asks us "Whence?" and every coffin "Whither?"

column2: The largest and the nobler faith in all that is, and is to be, tells us that death, even at its worst, is only perfect rest.
column3: The largest and the nobler faith in all that is, and is to be, tells us that death, even at its worst, is only perfect rest.

column2: My Friends: I am going to do that which the dead often promised he would do for me.
column3: My Friends: I am going to do that which the dead often promised he would do for me.

column2: He had not passed on life's highway the stone that marks the highest point, but being weary for a moment he lay down by the wayside, and, using his burden for a pillow, fell into that dreamless sleep that kisses down his eyelids still.
column3: He had not passed on life's highway the stone that marks the highest point, but being weary for a moment he lay down by the wayside, and, using his burden for a pillow, fell into that dreamless sleep that kisses down his eyelids still.

column2: While yet in love with life and raptured with the world, he passed to silence and pathetic dust.
column3: While yet in love with life and raptured with the world, he passed to silence and pathetic dust.

column2: He loved the beautiful and was with color, form and music touched to tears.
column3: He loved the beautiful and was with color, form and music touched to tears.

column2: Speech can not contain our love.
column3: Speech can not contain our love.
